com.cyc.query

Interface Query

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, InferenceParameterGetter, InferenceParameterSetter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    QueryImpl

    public interface Query
extends Closeable, InferenceParameterSetter, InferenceParameterGetter
    QueryImpl is designed to represent queries posed to Cyc and provide access to their results.

    In general, the process of getting an answer from Cyc is:

    1. Create a QueryImpl object and set relevant fields on it.
    2. Access the answers via methods like #getAnswersCyc(), getResultSet(), or by adding a listener via addListener(com.cyc.query.QueryListener) and starting the query via performInference().
    3. To avoid filling up memory on the Cyc server, close() the QueryImpl when you are done with it, which will free up any lingering associated inference resources on the Cyc image. Queries are also closed when their #finalize() method is invoked, notably when they are garbage collected.

      • registerRequiredSKSModules

        void registerRequiredSKSModules()
        Ensure that any required Semantic Knowledge Source removal modules for this query have been registered on the Cyc Server and made available for inference.

        This should be done prior to running a query or set of queries that relies on real-time access to external knowledge sources.

        Required knowledge sources are noted in the KB using the predicate sksiModulesNeeded.

        void save()
        Saves this Query as the term which is its current ID.

      • bindVariable

        void bindVariable(Variable var,
                Object replacement)
        Bind a query variable to a specified value. All occurrences of the variable in this query's sentence will be replaced with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        var - must be a query variable in this query.
        replacement - the value to substitute for var.

      • getQueryVariables

        Collection<Variable> getQueryVariables()
                                       throws KBApiException
        Return a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are sought. Note that this is a copy of the variables, and modification of the returned value will not result in modifications of the underlying QueryImpl.
        Returns:
        a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are to be sought.
        Throws:
        KBApiException

      • continueQuery

        void continueQuery()
        Continues the query. Can be used if a query has not been started yet, has stopped due to reaching the specified number of answers, or has used its alloted time or other resources and is continuable.

        Any resource constraints, e.g. time or number, get to "start over," so if the inference has already used its alloted 5 seconds, or found the specified three answers, continuing it will allow it to run for up to another 5 seconds, or until it finds up to another three answers.

        Returns when the inference has stopped running.

        See Also:
        setMaxNumber(Integer), setMaxTime(Integer), isContinuable(), setContinuable(boolean), InferenceWorker#continueInference(com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters)

      • findRedundantClauses

        Collection<Collection<Sentence>> findRedundantClauses()
                                                      throws KBApiException,
                                                             SessionCommunicationException,
                                                             OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Identifies redundant clauses in this query. For instance, if one clause isa (isa ?X Dog) and another is (isa ?X GreatDane), that pair is considered redundant. This method provides no guidance as to what can or should be done to resolve the redundancy, and in fact it may be virtually harmless, as Cyc can often solve such a query almost as efficiently as it can solve the more specific clause of the pair.
        Returns:
        a collection of pairs of any such clauses
        Throws:
        KBApiException
        SessionCommunicationException
        OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server.

      • findUnconnectedClauses

        Collection<ArgPosition> findUnconnectedClauses()
                                               throws SessionCommunicationException,
                                                      OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Identifies unconnected clauses in this query. Generally, all clauses of a query will be connected by a chain of variables that connect them together. Queries with unconnected clauses are effectively separate queries, and running queries with disconnected clauses generally results in a cartesian product of the answer sets of the two separate queries.
        Returns:
        a collection of the arg positions of any such clauses
        Throws:
        SessionCommunicationException - if there is a problem communicating with Cyc.
        OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server.

      • merge

        Query merge(Query otherQuery)
            throws QueryConstructionException,
                   SessionCommunicationException,
                   OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Conjoin this sentence with otherQuery, attempting to unify and rename variables. Typically, two different variables will unify into a single variable, causing all the uses of one of the variables to be renamed with the name of the other. In some cases, additional renaming may happen (e.g. if the queries contain mnemonic variables that become more tightly constrained as a result of the unification, a new mnemonic variable may be used in place of both of the original variables).
        Parameters:
        otherQuery -
        Returns:
        the new query
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException - if there was a problem constructing the new query
        SessionCommunicationException
        OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server.

      • isContinuable

        Boolean isContinuable()
        Check whether this Query is continuable. Queries that have not yet been run are considered continuable, as well as ones whose parameters have the continuable flag set.
        Specified by:
        isContinuable in interface InferenceParameterGetter
        Returns:
        true iff it can be continued.
        See Also:

      • setContinuable

        InferenceParameterSetter setContinuable(boolean b)
        Specify whether inferences should be continuable. Continuable inferences are used e.g. when a maximum number of answers has been specified. The inference will be suspended after an initial batch of answers has been found, and continuing it may then yield the next batch.
        Specified by:
        setContinuable in interface InferenceParameterSetter
        Returns:
        this QueryImpl
        See Also:
        continueQuery()

      • setMaxNumber

        InferenceParameterSetter setMaxNumber(Integer max)
        Set the maximum number of answers (or sets of answers) that Cyc will attempt to find for this Query. In some cases (such as when a set of answers is retrieved in a batch), more answers than this may actually be returned. Once this number of answers has been reached, Cyc will not actively look for additional answers.
        Specified by:
        setMaxNumber in interface InferenceParameterSetter
        Parameters:
        max -
        Returns:
        this Query
        See Also:
        com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters#setMaxNumber(Integer)

      • setQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause

        Query setQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause(Sentence sentence)
        Sets the hypothesized clause of this QueryImpl. When the query is run, Cyc will assume that this clause is true. If the clause is independently known to be false in the query context, the query will be considered tautologous, and will fail.
        Parameters:
        sentence -
        Returns:
        this QueryImpl.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if query has already been started.
        See Also:
        getQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause()

        this QueryImpl.
        Throws:

      • stop

        void stop(Integer patience)
        Issues a request that the query stop immediately.
        Parameters:
        patience - If non-null, the query will be forcibly aborted if it does not stop before this many seconds have elapsed.

      • retainInference

        void retainInference()
        Specify that this inference should be retained by Cyc until the Query is closed. This can be called before the query has been started, and must be called before the query has finished running.
        See Also:
        close()

      • getAnswerCount

        Returns the number of answers found for this query. For running queries, the value returned by this method may change as additional answers are found.
        Returns:
        the number of answers found for this query.

      • clearResults

        Query clearResults()
        Forget all results for this query. All settings on the Query are retained, including the query sentence, context, and inference parameters. After a QueryImpl has been cleared, it can be re-run, with possibly different results.
        Returns:
        this Query

      • getMaxTime

        Integer getMaxTime()
        Returns the soft timeout for this QueryImpl in seconds.
        Specified by:
        getMaxTime in interface InferenceParameterGetter
        Returns:
        the soft timeout for this QueryImpl in seconds.
        See Also:
        com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters#getMaxTime()

      • getMaxNumber

        Integer getMaxNumber()
        Returns the maximum number of answers (or sets of answers) that Cyc will attempt to find for this Query. In some cases (such as when a set of answers is retrieved in a batch), more answers than this may actually be returned. Once this number of answers has been reached, Cyc will not actively look for additional answers.
        Specified by:
        getMaxNumber in interface InferenceParameterGetter
        Returns:
        the number cutoff for this Query.
        See Also:
        com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters#getMaxNumber()

      • getInferenceMode

        InferenceMode getInferenceMode()
        Returns the inference mode for this Query.
        Specified by:
        getInferenceMode in interface InferenceParameterGetter
        Returns:
        the inference mode for this Query.
        See Also:
        com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters#getInferenceMode()

      • getStatus

        InferenceStatus getStatus()
        Return the InferenceStatus for this Query.
        Returns:
        the InferenceStatus for this Query.

      • getSuspendReason

        InferenceSuspendReason getSuspendReason()
        Return the reason why this QueryImpl was suspended (if it was).
        Returns:
        the reason, or null if this QueryImpl was not suspended.
        See Also:
        for examples.

      • isTrue

        boolean isTrue()
        Returns:
        true iff this query has been proven true.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the query has open variables.
        See Also:
        InferenceResultSet.getTruthValue()

      • isProvable

        boolean isProvable()
        Is this query either True (if a boolean query) or does it have bindings (if non-boolean)
        Returns:
        True if there are bindings (or it's a true boolean query), false if there are no bindings (or it's a false boolean query).

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this query's result set, and releases resources on the Cyc server. See com.cyc.query.KBInferenceResultSet#close() for more details on what happens when a query is closed.

        It is good practice to always invoke this method explicitly as soon as a QueryImpl is no longer needed, as they can take up significant amounts of memory on the Cyc server.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        See Also:
        com.cyc.query.KBInferenceResultSet#close()

      • getCloseTimeout

        long getCloseTimeout()
        Returns the timeout for the close() method.
        Returns:
        timeout in milliseconds

      • setCloseTimeout

        void setCloseTimeout(long timeoutMS)
        Sets the timeout for the close() method.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMS - timeout in milliseconds

      • getResultSet

        QueryResultSet getResultSet()
        Returns:
        this query's result set. The KBInferenceResultSet is an object that may be updated dynamically for running queries. This contrasts with #getAnswersCyc() which returns a static list of the answers at the time is was called.
        See Also:
        com.cyc.query.KBInferenceResultSet
